summary: An Ordinance providing for the improvement of East Madison Street, from Thirty-third Avenue North to East Mercer Street; Thirty-second Avenue North, from the alley south of East Madison Street to Washington Boulevard; and Washington Boulevard, from Thirty-second Avenue North to East Madison Street, all in the City of Seattle, by constructing therein sewers of proper dimensions and material, together with all wyes, openings, manholes, flush tanks, catch basins, and other appurtenances, in accordance with Resolution No. 112 of the City Council of the City of Seattle, and providing for the payment therefor by the mode of "Payment by Bonds," as provided by an act of the Legislature of the State of Washington, entitled "An act authorizing issuance and sale of bonds by cities, to pay for local improvements, providing for the payment thereof, and declaring an emergency," approved March 14, 1899, and Ordinance No. 5693 of said city, approved December 6, 1899.
